section.title: Overview
section.para: You use the module to track the events related to your transactions initiated through the Portal, together with any custom events (like appointments or reminders) related to the activity of your company, in much the same way that you would through a shared electronic calendar.

This module enables you to monitor key dates related to the products handled by the system, as well as adding your own custom events or alerts, turning your Portal page into an automated and customised scheduler.

The calendar appears on your home page, together with today's events. It is also accessible as a full screen application where events can be displayed by day, month or by type over a longer period of time in the Milestones View. For any event related to an existing transaction, a dedicated link gives you access to the transaction details and history through a single mouse click.
The following sections describe the three main components of the module.

section.title: Calendar Component
section.para: This component displays the calendar itself. It displays a calendar for the month, the current business date in your time zone highlighted, and serves as a table of contents to access the details of any date. Click a day to see a full page view of that day's events. Click the month name to see a full-page view of the month's events. Click the arrows around the month name to see the orevious and following months.

Days associated with key dates are automatically highlighted with a specific background colour. With this visual information, it is easy to detect right from the home page the key transactional events taking place during the month.

section.title: Trade Events Component
section.para: This component summarises the key events of the current date and displays various alerts related to pending transactions or recent notifications. This section of the screen is composed of three subsections, each covering a specific type of event. Depending on your site, you may not have all three of these subsections.

section.title: Today's Events
section.para: This list is a summary of all the events of the current day. Events shown are those for your company's transactions, plus any custom events manually added by any of your company's users.
The transactions displayed are the records bearing a key date equal to the current business date.
Click the heading Today to display a more detailed list of events..
Click Add to add an event to the calendar. An event can be Private (only be seen by you), or Public (shared by all user in your company).

section.title: Recent Pending Transactions
section.para: This list shows the most recent pending transactions initiated within your company, for any product and any type of transaction, whether initiation, amendment or message. Pending means Incomplete (Draft) or Uncontrolled (Unsigned), and hence not yet sent to the bank.

Each entry shows the transaction's System ID, followed by the product code and the transaction type (New, Amend, or Message). Click the System ID to open the transaction record in the appropriate mode for its status. That is, a transaction that only needs to be signed opens in non-editable mode, whereas an incomplete record opens in the edit form for its transaction type.

To avoid over-crowding your home page, the list shows, by default, only the 5 most recent such transactions (sorted by input date). This can be changed by setting a different value in the relevant configuration file.

section.title: Application Component
section.para: When you click a date or the month name in the Calendar component on your home page, it opens the application to show a full-page view.

section.title: Menu
section.para: The full-screen view has a calendar just like that on the home page, on the left-hand side. This is called Standard view. Click Switch to Milestones View beneath it is to switch to Milestones View.
In Standard view, the view is limited to one month and you can enter two dates within 30 days to limit its search. To display a single day, set both dates equal to that day.

Standard view is the default one when the application opens. If you clicked a specific day, the main part of the screen shows all the events of that day. If you clicked a month name, it shows all the events of the month. In both cases, click Add button at the bottom of the page to add a private or public custom event to the calendar.

In Milestones view, the search can span over a period of up to three months. Key dates are not grouped by date, but rather by product and then product type. The date range can be set in the search criteria fields at the top of the screen. To return to Standard view, click Switch to Standard View, below the calendar.

section.title: List of Events
section.para: As usual with lists, you can enter search criteria in a group of fields at the top of the list and click Search, to make the list show only records that match these criteria.

section.title: Add / Edit an Event
section.para:
Click Edit
to display an input form with the current details of this custom event. You can change the date, the title or the description of this event.
Clicking the Add icon at the end of the list displays the same form but empty.
The form has the following input fields:

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
Date of the event. In the case of an update of existing event, changing the date will automatically move the event to the new date.
Title for the event. This is the string of characters that subsequently appears in the list of events. Maximum 35 characters.
Set this to Public to share the event with your colleagues, typically to announce company-wide events; or to Private for your own individual agenda.
Details of the event. Maximum of 30 lines of 65 characters.

section.title: Delete an Event
section.para:
Click Delete
to delete a custom event from the calendar. A public event can be deleted by any user in the company. A private event can only be deleted by the user who created it.

section.title: View an Event
section.para:
Click View
to view the date, title and full description of the event in a non-editable form.
